intro: Thesium annulatum, commonly known as the ringed thesium, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, ring-like structure in its flower clusters. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often on rocky soils. Its flowers are small and yellowish, arranged in dense, cylindrical inflorescences. Thesium annulatum is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
